intro: Hieracium dolichellum, commonly known as the long-stemmed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and daisy-like appearance. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and meadows, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are alternate, rough, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Hieracium dolichellum is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats and is often found in areas with moderate to full sunlight.
